intro: Terminalia benguellensis subsp. ovalis, commonly known as the oval terminalia, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Combretaceae and is characterized by its smooth, grey bark and elongated, oval-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers followed by woody, elongated fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
